str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
